content: I doubt Thunderbird can store/retrieve anyones deleted emails. Tbird can tell the email service to leave mails on the server or not, depending on your setting. (Account Settings>Server settings>leave messages on server). Try consulting with your ISP - its their servers.
creator: jeff-g

content:
Try this, it should make for more consistency:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Appearance > Fonts > Advanced button

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Latin if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes

- set Minimum font size to None

- at the top, change set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems

- repeat the process of changing fonts/sizes

- at the bottom, make sure 'Allow messages to use other fonts' is disabled if desired > OK > close the popup

- set TB menu > Settings > Composition > HTML Style to Variable Width and Medium font

I had set Minimum font size to 16. It's now set to None.

I had tried variations of HTML Style to Variable Width and Fixed before but now set to Variable Width. Font was already set to Medium.

A quick test response to an email i received seemed to work as i liked and worked consistently. The text size could be slightly larger for me & my screen. Will try 17 and see what it does.

Once again, thank you.

content:
When setting up the font size for composing: go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Appearance > Fonts > Advanced button

re : change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes - I had both of these set to 16.

Yes that 16 means 16px and whatever you set will be regarded as 'Medium' font size and used when composing.

re :I had set Minimum font size to 16. It's now set to None.

I do not recommend that because you are already thinking that size 16 is too small to use as 'medium'. Setting to none means if people send using a tint font you may have difficulty reading it, so I would recommend setting 14 to force tiny font to be a size 14.

Remember - whatever you set for 'Latin' must also be set for 'Other Writing Systems' this means both western encoding and unicode encoding will use same settings.

General font size used in Folder Pane, Thread Pane Menus etc can be set here: Menu app icon (3 lines) > Font Size - default is 12, so click on the + icon to increase size. Keep clicking until you have a good reading size.

In Settings > Composing If you want to use Body text as default when composing:

  • uncheck 'Use Paragraph format instead of body text'

content:
Date le molte segnalazioni le informazioni e gli aggiornamenti su questo problema sono raccolte in questa pagina -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79683.0

Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

Potresti fare questa verifica?

  1. Apri Thunderbird
  2. Fai click su Nuovo messaggio
  3. Ora usa la combinazione di tasto Alt + TAB per vedere quali finestre sono aperte in Windows

Vedi finestre secondarie riferite a Thunderbird?
creator: @next

content: Hello, The error message is vague, but similar messages happen when the wrong SMTP server is used. Do you have more than one account? If so, click 'account settings', then click the name of the account, now, at bottom of screen is a link to the SMTP server for the account. Click the 'edit ' message there. Is that the server and email address for the account? if not, click the dropdown menu and select the appropriate one and then retry to send a message.
creator: davidsk

content:
I have come across some people who experienced oversized pop windows for various things being too large and checking the following settings are using the default sorted out the problem. See if this is effecting you.

Please check the following:

  • Settings > General
  • scroll down to bottom
  • click the 'Config editor' button
  • It opens in a new tab
  • In search type: perpx
  • look for: layout.css.devPixelsPerPx
  • default has negative number -1.0 setting
  • click on the pencil icon
  • Remove the current setting and type : -1.0
  • click on the tick icon to save.

Restart Thunderbird

content: A known bug - which might still be alive - that the 'new message' button does not work if there is not a default account defined. check 'account settings' - the default account will have a star to the right of the account name. Set a default and let us know if problems are resolved.
creator: davidsk

content:
David,

I just got your reply, and I want to thank you!! That was the problem and it fixed BOTH problems.

The "forward as attachment" now initiates a new email, and the "+ New Message" button works as it should.

( I had worked out a temporary fix that might be useful to you down the road somehow. I could use the "Reply to Sender only" and get a message started. I cleaned out the "To", "Subject", and body of the email, and saved it as a "Draft", so that I could open it and use it. )

Thanks again for all your team does, it makes me glad I am an annual donor!

content: This is controlled by a file named popstate.dat within the profile in the mail\<POPaccount> folder. If you delete that file, thunderbird will start from scratch. That may not be what you want, but I wanted to share the info, just in case.

content: The addressbook and account data are in the profile, but it is up to the user to do backups. Thunderbird does not have a cloud where it keeps copies of user accounts. There are such services, but there is a fee for them.
